body: RequestLastSeen methos is for knowing recipient's last access time for a message, am I wrong? I tried the correct version of this method with 2 arguments but it does not return anything, rather it calls a protected function sendNode() and this function calls another protected function sendData(). So how to get the last seen time? Please help, I am stuck in middle of a project

comment_data.body: The RequestLastSeen method works just fine to me. All I did was provide: time() - "1" as first argument and voila.

I saved -1. time() in a separate variable $msgid, and used both in Message() and RequestLastSeen() method. But the RequestLastSeen() method has no return value? Did you just echo the RequestLastSeen() or used another method to get it's value?
@nitam : Kindly reply what  g0g0l asked. Please let us know how to use RequestLastSeen function in php ? what exactly we have to mention to get the result?

@nitam : I don't see in your example above the mobile number of which we want to know Last Seen Time.

Can you please explain where to use your code... in testprotocol.php ?

No, in whatsapp.php, -i and/or -s, both calls of the RequestLastSeen() method. The mobile number is part of the required arguments to run whether the interactive mode or simply send a message to the given number.
I thought it could be obvious, but it seems it's not.

php whatsapp.php -i <phone_number_including_country_code>,

While into the interactive mode (and after the necessary change) type: /lastseen  and that command will provide you the last seen info of the number you are interacting with.

@g0g0l : with your code I get  "Array ( )" as print data 

how to get the timestamp ?
As I wrote, there is no element that shows time, but refresh the page, u will get message id, recipient's number and delivery report (if it is delivered at all)
I myself could not achieve this, maybe u should try what @nitam says

title: RequestLastSeen problem
